--- title: "Directed Acyclic Graphs" author: "Moritz Seefeldt" --- # Assignment 1 ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-1_a7c2735a14710f0ff8e1cfc52cf3e604'} ```{.r .cell-code} # Confounder confounding <- dagify( X ~ Z, Y ~ Z, Y ~ X, coords = list(x = c(Y = 3, Z = 2, X = 1), y = c(Y = 0, Z = 1, X = 0)), labels = list(X = "Parking spot available", Y = "Sales", Z = "Customers") ) # Plot DAG ggdag(confounding) + #geom_dag_point(color = ggthemr::swatch()[2]) + geom_dag_text(color = "white") + geom_dag_edges(edge_color = "white") + geom_dag_label_repel(aes(label = label)) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: # Assignment 2 ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-2_83f19be5311c3756285512d8467dde10'} ```{.r .cell-code} df <- readRDS("data/customer_sat.rds") str(df) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> tibble [15 Ã— 3] (S3: tbl_df/tbl/data.frame) #> $ follow_ups : num [1:15] 8 7 8 9 10 6 7 6 8 8 ... #> $ satisfaction: num [1:15] 40 45 47 44 50 55 60 62 59 65 ... #> $ subscription: chr [1:15] "Elite" "Elite" "Elite" "Elite" ... ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} df ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
````` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model1 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = df) summary(model1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups, data = df) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -12.412 -5.257 1.733 4.506 12.588 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 78.8860 4.2717 18.467 1.04e-10 *** #> follow_ups -3.3093 0.6618 -5.001 0.000243 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 7.923 on 13 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.658, Adjusted R-squared: 0.6316 #> F-statistic: 25.01 on 1 and 13 DF, p-value: 0.0002427 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model2 <- lm(satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = df) summary(model2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` #> #> Call: #> lm(formula = satisfaction ~ follow_ups + subscription, data = df) #> #> Residuals: #> Min 1Q Median 3Q Max #> -4.3222 -2.1972 0.3167 2.2667 3.9944 #> #> Coefficients: #> Estimate Std. Error t value Pr(>|t|) #> (Intercept) 26.7667 6.6804 4.007 0.00206 ** #> follow_ups 2.1944 0.7795 2.815 0.01682 * #> subscriptionPremium 44.7222 5.6213 7.956 6.88e-06 *** #> subscriptionPremium+ 18.0722 2.1659 8.344 4.37e-06 *** #> --- #> Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 #> #> Residual standard error: 2.958 on 11 degrees of freedom #> Multiple R-squared: 0.9597, Adjusted R-squared: 0.9487 #> F-statistic: 87.21 on 3 and 11 DF, p-value: 5.956e-08 ``` ::: ::: # Assignment 3 The estimated coefficient for the number of follow-up calls is negative, meaning the satisfaction is expected to decrease if the customer receives more calls. However, this appears to originate from the connection between the number of follow-up calls and the subscription model. The estimated coefficient for the number of follow-up calls while accounting for the subscription model is positive, meaning that the satisfaction is expected to increase with the number of calls while within a given subscription model. This could be indicative of the fact that the customer might be experiencing more issues and problems with the software for more expensive subscription models (while also having higher expectations?). The data still suggests that making more follow-up calls will result in a higher customer satisfaction. # Assignment 4 ::: {.cell hash='05_dag_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-3_de3ceb99c521ccaf16cb168444657f5e'} ```{.r .cell-code} satisfaction_not_cond <- ggplot(df, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction)) + geom_point() + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) # Conditioning on subscription satisfaction_cond <- ggplot(df, aes(x = follow_ups, y = satisfaction, color = subscription, alpha = subscription)) + geom_point() + stat_smooth(method = "lm", se = F) + scale_color_manual(values = c("Elite" = "red", "Premium+" = "blue", "Premium" = "green")) + scale_alpha_manual(values = c("Elite" = 1, "Premium+" = 0.6, "Premium" = 0.2)) + theme(legend.position = "right") satisfaction_not_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-1.png){width=672} ::: ```{.r .cell-code} satisfaction_cond ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` #> `geom_smooth()` using formula = 'y ~ x' ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](05_dag_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-3-2.png){width=672} ::: :::
